metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6156 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Incorect derivation of a packet length in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 68.0.3440.75 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted video file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

firefox - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
